about.summary: Encapsulates the pattern of untidying data into a wide matrix, performing some processing, then turning it back into a tidy form. This is useful for several operations such as co-occurrence counts, correlations, or clustering that are mathematically convenient on wide matrices.

name: r-widyr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-widyr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: widyr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/widyr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/widyr/widyr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 96b66ac6475c245d840c6738192a653270c9786a402973e2b0959e4870c42193

build:
  noarch: generic
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1001
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{posix}}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix
    - r-broom
    - r-dplyr
    - r-purrr
    - r-reshape2
    - r-tidyr
    - r-tidytext
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix
    - r-broom
    - r-dplyr
    - r-purrr
    - r-reshape2
    - r-tidyr
    - r-tidytext

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('widyr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('widyr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://github.com/dgrtwo/widyr
  license: MIT
  summary: Encapsulates the pattern of untidying data into a wide matrix, performing some processing,
    then turning it back into a tidy form. This is useful for several operations such
    as co-occurrence counts, correlations, or clustering that are mathematically convenient
    on wide matrices.
  license_family: MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
    - cbrueffer
    - dbast
